p: Myanmar is the largest country in mainland Southeast Asia. The country has a tropical monsoon climate, with three main seasonsâ€“cool (Nov.-Feb.), hot (Mar.-May) and wet (Jun.-Oct.). Myanmar contains a diversity of ecosystems ( Fig 1), which harbor high levels of biodiversity, endemism and species richness. However, its natural resources are being degraded or lost as the country accelerates its pace of economic growth. With a population of 51.4 million, its per capita GDP is just over US$1,000, but GDP growth exceeds 8% [ 26].
